15 void printCells(nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid) {
16  for (unsigned int row=0;row<grid.info.height;row++){
17  for (unsigned int col=0;col<grid.info.width;col++){
18  unsigned int index=(row*grid.info.height)+col;
19  std::cout << static_cast<int>(grid.data.at(index)) << " ";
20  }
21  std::cout << std::endl;
22  }
23 
24 }

29 TEST(GeneratedOgMap,ConnectionTest){
30 
33 
34  float mapSize=4.0;
35  float resolution=0.1;
36 
37  unsigned int size_x = static_cast<unsigned int>(mapSize/resolution);
38  unsigned int size_y = static_cast<unsigned int>(mapSize/resolution);
39 
40  //Here we generate a new OgMap message
41  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
42  grid.info.width = size_x;
43  grid.info.height = size_y;
44  grid.info.resolution = resolution;
45  grid.data.assign(size_x * size_y, -1); //And we create a vector os size_x * size_y values, with each element of vector assigned value -1
46 
47  // Let's check the first cell in OgMap is -1
48  ASSERT_EQ(-1,grid.data.at(0));
49 
50  // ^ y
51  // |
52  // |
53  // o------> x
54  //
55 
56  // We have to initialse each part of the structire seperatley : https://github.com/ros/ros_comm/issues/148
57  geometry_msgs::Point origin;//Origin is a struct
58  origin.x=0.1;origin.y=0.6;origin.z=0;
59  geometry_msgs::Point dest;
60  dest.x=1.5;dest.y=1.5;dest.z=0;
61 
62  GridProcessing gridProcessing(grid);
63 
64  // Should the OgMap allow the origin and destination to be connected in a straight line if all point are occupied
65  ASSERT_FALSE(gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(origin,dest));
66 
67  //Let's augument the OgMap now to be occupied
68  grid.data.assign(size_x * size_y, 0); //each element of vector assigned value 0 (free space)
69 
70  // Let's check the first cell in OgMap is 0
71  ASSERT_EQ(0,grid.data.at(0));
72 
73  gridProcessing.setGrid(grid);//Let's set this new grid now in our gridProcessing object
74 
75  // Does the image now allow the origin and destination to be connected with a straight line if all cells are free?
76  ASSERT_TRUE(gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(origin,dest));
77 
78 
79  // Let's now be a bit more systematic, how about an OgMap that is all free cells
80  // Apart from a line that goes down the middle (the y axis)?
81  // Let's make a line of occupied cells down the middle
82  std::vector<int8_t>& map_data (grid.data); // In this step we now have the actual cell data inside map_data
83 
84  for (unsigned int row=0;row<grid.info.height;row++){//This now gives us now the row
85  //It's a row major
86  //Our ine will go through the middle, so the column in middle
87  unsigned int index = row*grid.info.width + (grid.info.width/2);
88  map_data.at(index)=100;
89  }
90  gridProcessing.setGrid(grid);//Let's set this new grid now in our gridProcessing object
91 
92  //printCells(grid);
93 
94  //:et's pick a point on either size of the y axis
95  origin.x=-1.5;origin.y=0.0;
96  dest.x=1.5;dest.y=0.0;
97 
98  // Does the image now allow the origin and destination to be connected with a straight line, it shoudl NOT!
99  ASSERT_FALSE(gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(origin,dest));
100 
109  //We reset it to all zeros
110  grid.data.assign(size_x * size_y, 0);
111  {
112  std::vector<int8_t>& map_data (grid.data); // In this step we now have the actual cell data inside map_data
113 
114  for (unsigned int row=0;row<grid.info.height;row++){//This now gives us now the row
115  //It's a row major
116 
117  for (unsigned int col=10;col<=30;col++)
118  if((row < 15 ) || (row>25)){
119  unsigned int index = row*grid.info.width + col;
120  map_data.at(index)=100;
121  }
122  }
123  }
124  gridProcessing.setGrid(grid);//Let's set this new grid now in our gridProcessing object
125 
126  //printCells(grid);
127 
128  //let's pick a point on either size of the y axis
129  origin.x=-1.5;origin.y=0.0;
130  dest.x=1.5;dest.y=0.0;
131 
132  // Does the image now allow the origin and destination to be connected with a straight line, it shoudl NOT!
133  ASSERT_TRUE(gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(origin,dest));
134 
135  //let's pick a point on either size of the y axis
136  origin.x=-1.5;origin.y=-1.5;
137  dest.x=1.5;dest.y=1.5;
138 
139  // Does the image now allow the origin and destination to be connected with a straight line, it shoudl NOT!
140  ASSERT_FALSE(gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(origin,dest));
141 
142 }

144 TEST(LoadedOgMap,ConnectionTest){
145 
148 
149 
151  std::string path = ros::package::getPath("week11");
153  path += "/test/samples/";
155  std::string file = path + "sample.bag";
156 
158  rosbag::Bag bag;
159  bag.open(file); // BagMode is Read by default
160 
161  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid::ConstPtr grid;//We need to have a pointer to extract the grid
162 
163  for(rosbag::MessageInstance const m: rosbag::View(bag))
164  {
165  grid = m.instantiate<nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid>();
166  if (grid != nullptr){
167  // Now we have the first grid in bag so we can proceed
168  break;
169  }
170  }
171 
172  bag.close();
173 
174  ASSERT_NE(grid, nullptr);//Check that we have a grid from the bag
175 
176  GridProcessing gridProcessing(*grid);
177 
178  geometry_msgs::Point origin;//Origin is a struct
179  origin.x=0.0;origin.y=0.0;
180  geometry_msgs::Point dest;
181  dest.x=-4.0;dest.y=0.0;
182 
183  // Should the OgMap allow the origin and destination to be connected in a straight line if all point are occupied
184  ASSERT_FALSE(gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(origin,dest));
185 
186  origin.x=0.0;origin.y=0.0;
187  dest.x=0.0;dest.y=3.0;
188 
189  // Should the OgMap allow the origin and destination to be connected in a straight line if all point are occupied
190  ASSERT_TRUE(gridProcessing.checkConnectivity(origin,dest));
191 
199 }
